title: Seeking Persephone
author: Sarah M. Eden
description: A thoughtful and emotionally rich Regency romance about a reclusive duke who enters a marriage of convenience with a spirited young woman, only to discover that trust, healing, and love require far more courage than either expected.

title: Percy Jackson and the Olympians
author: Rick Riordan
description: A fast-paced, modern fantasy series following Percy Jackson, a twelve-year-old who discovers he is the son of a Greek god and is thrust into a world of monsters, quests, and ancient prophecies that challenge his courage and identity.
setting: Modern-day United States blended with locations from Greek mythology

title: Wings of Fire: The Hidden Kingdom
author: Tui T. Sutherland
description: The third installment in the Wings of Fire series follows Glory as she journeys into the mysterious RainWing kingdom, uncovering secrets, missing dragons, and a dangerous threat that challenges her courage and leadership.
setting: The RainWing Kingdom and surrounding jungles of Pyrrhia

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A sweeping tale of betrayal, survival, and calculated revenge, following Edmond Dantès as he transforms from a wrongfully imprisoned sailor into the enigmatic Count of Monte Cristo, determined to reshape the fates of those who wronged him.
setting: France, Italy, and the Mediterranean during the early 19th century

title: The Outsiders
author: S. E. Hinton
description: A powerful coming‑of‑age story that follows Ponyboy Curtis as he navigates loyalty, identity, and the harsh realities of class conflict between the Greasers and the Socs.
setting: A mid‑1960s American town marked by sharp social divides

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A haunting tale of ambition and consequence, following Victor Frankenstein as he creates a living being from assembled parts, only to face the devastating fallout of abandoning the creature he brought into the world.
setting: Europe in the late 18th century, spanning Switzerland, Germany, Scotland, and the Arctic

title: Coraline
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A curious young girl discovers a hidden doorway to an eerie parallel world where everything seems perfect—until she realizes the sinister truth behind the Other Mother’s intentions.
setting: A modern-day apartment building and its unsettling mirror-world counterpart
